attributes.name: PhoneInput
attributes.description:
A phone-input component. Usage:

  {{phone-input
  allowDropdown=false
  autoPlaceholder='aggressive'
  disabled=true
  required=required
  autocomplete=autocomplete
  initialCountry='fr'
  number='123'
  onlyCountries=europeanCountries
  preferredCountries=englishSpeakingCountries
  separateDialCode=true
  update=(action 'handleUpdate')}}

arguments.name: disabled
arguments.description: Setting this to true will disabled the input and the country dropdown. Defaults to false

arguments.name: required
arguments.description: Setting this to true will make the input field required. This will enabled client side form validation. Defaults to false

arguments.name: autocomplete
arguments.description: autocomplete attribute on input field. Can be used to support browser autocompletion. Defaults to null

arguments.name: number
arguments.description: The international phone number. This is the main data supposed to be persisted / handled.

arguments.name: allowDropdown
arguments.description: Whether or not to allow the dropdown. If disabled, there is no dropdown arrow, and the selected flag is not clickable. Also we display the selected flag on the right instead because it is just a marker of state.

arguments.name: autoPlaceholder
arguments.description: Add or remove input placeholder with an example number for the selected country. Possible values are 'polite', 'aggressive' and 'off'. Defaults to 'polite'.

arguments.name: initialCountry
arguments.description: It will just be the first country in the list. Set the initial country by it's country code. Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: country
arguments.description: It will force the selected country. Set the country by it's country code. Usefull if you want to provide the component with a country, instead of using the built-in country dropdown. Defaults to ''.

arguments.name: onlyCountries
arguments.description: Display only the countries you specify - see example.

arguments.name: preferredCountries
arguments.description: Specify the countries to appear at the top of the list.

arguments.name: separateDialCode
arguments.description: Display the country dial code next to the selected flag so it's not part of the typed number

arguments.name: update
arguments.description: You have to implement this function to update the number.
